name: Processing
summary: Syntax highlighting for the Processing language
description:
This is a syntax highlighting file and ftplugin for Processing.  

Processing is a system for programmatically creating images and animations.  See http://www.processing.org/ for more info.  The syntax highlighting file was made using lib/keywords.txt from the Processing 0135 BETA distribution.

Integration with the documentation:

If you have a Vim built with Python, the K key can be used to look up functions and variables in the documentation.  Note that words followed
by an opening paren "(" are treated as functions, thus K pressed on frameRate() and frameRate goes to different documentation pages.

If there are highlighting errors while scrolling backwards, set the processing_minlines variable to a higher value.
install_details:
1. Extract the archive into your Vim runtime directory (~/.vim on UNIX, $VIM\vimfiles on Windows)
2. Set the path to the Processing documentation in your vimrc, e.g.

  let processing_doc_path="c:\\Programs\\Processing\\reference"

3. The ftplugin sets the shiftwidth, tabstop and expandtab.  Comment/remove these from ftplugin/processing.vim if you don't like them.
4. Enjoy!

versions.release_notes: Fixed unmatched bracket highlighting and other minor fixes.
Added highlighting for unmatched brackets and an ftplugin for integration with the documentation.
